description.en:
Design thinking offers an opportunity to experience, explore and solve complicated, many-faceted problems of innovation, systems design, and process management as a specific toolbox and the set of cognitive, strategic, and practical processes. It is a way to improve and systematize thinking based on experience from different fields.
The theoretical-practical course focuses on developing and improving creativity and entrepreneurial skills, analyzing the connections between science and culture, using creative practices of design thinking.
During the course, students can specialize according to their interests, professional background, and field.
description.et:
Mõiste "disainmõtlemine" (design thinking) pakub tänapäeval rikkalikke tööriistu innovatsiooni, süsteemidisaini ja protsesside juhtimise alal. See on mõtlemise süstematiseerimise viis, mis kasutab erinevate valdkondade kogemusi. 
Teoreetilis-praktiline kursus keskendub loovuse ja ettevõtlikkuse arendamisele, mõtestades teaduse ja kultuuri seoseid, kasutades disainmõtlemise loovaid praktikaid.
Kursusel saavad üliõpilased spetsialiseeruda vastavalt oma huvidele, erialasele taustale ja valdkonnale.

objectives.en: The course aims to introduce the basic principles of design thinking to apply creative and imaginative methods to point towards future solutions in different fields.
objectives.et: Aine eesmärk on tutvustada disainmõtlemise aluspõhimõtteid, et rakendada loovaid mängulisi töövõtteid tulevikuprobleemide lahendamiseks erinevates valdkondades.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. knows the basic principles, unpredictable ways of design thinking - inspiration, imagination, implementation;
learning_outcomes.et: 1. tunneb disainmõtlemise aluspõhimõtteid ja üllatuslikke seoseid;

learning_outcomes.en: 2. knows how to collect and analyze inspiring data;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab koguda ja mõtestada inspireerivat materjali;

learning_outcomes.en: 3. can demonstrate independent thinking and experimenting;
4. can formulate, develop and present his/her ideas.
learning_outcomes.et: 4. oskab oma ideid arendada ja esitada.

independent_work.et:
There will be five lecture practicums during the semester. Each lecture is accompanied by a practical task, followed by independent work on a written and practical assignment based on the recommended literature. Discussions in seminars take place based on independent work.
There will be five seminars in the semester to prepare which homework will take place (for each workshop, it is necessary to write 1 A4 author's text, which connects the lecture-practicum and homework topics) in group work and individual supervision. The questionnaire of the outcome is submitted before the colloquium. The independent work results are presented at the colloquium and discussed.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in lecture practicums and seminars (incl. independent listening of recorded lectures) will be at least 80%.

grade_evaluation.et: The originality of the student's author's texts is taken into account in the assessment. The lecturer may ask additional oral or written questions during the final examination to supplement the work.
